vulnurabilities.name: gets
vulnurabilities.description: Reads a line from stdin into the buffer pointed to by s until either a terminating newline or EOF.

vulnurabilities.name: fgets
vulnurabilities.description: reads a line from the specified stream and stores it into the string pointed to by str. It stops when either (n-1) characters are read, the newline character is read, or the end-of-file is reached, whichever comes first.

vulnurabilities.name: strcopy
vulnurabilities.description: Returns the number of items in a container.

vulnurabilities.name: input
vulnurabilities.description: Reads user input from the console.

functions.name: strcpy
functions.description: Copies the C string pointed by source into the array pointed by destination, including the terminating null character (and stopping at that point).

functions.name: strcat
functions.description: Appends a copy of the source string to the destination string. The terminating null character in destination is overwritten by the first character of source, and a new null-character is appended at the end of the new string formed by the concatenation of both in destination.

functions.name: sprintf
functions.description: Prints the formatted data to a string.

functions.name: vsprintf
functions.description: Prints the formatted data to a string.

functions.description: Reads a line from stdin into the buffer pointed to by s until either a terminating newline or EOF.

functions.name: input
functions.description: Reads user input from the console.
